column4: If I get Mint. Can I replace ubuntu with it without losing my data?
with backups or a separate home, probably.  But ask mint support
why?
why?  What do you hate about it?  unity (the default interface) or something else?
if you want something like gnome2, I'd suggest trying xfce.  There's no need to go back to 11.04, just install the desktop environment you want and choose it at login
what administrator options are lacking exactly?
and what exactly did you try that did not work?  There were many suggestions given to you.
update-manager is still in 11.10.  Not sure what you mean by "tab"
I'm not familiar with the unity interface, but you can run update-manager from a shell if you wish
why?  Try to be specific.
what do you mean by "get into it"?
so go back to the first 2 responses we gave you after you said that originally.  Read ubottu's message and consider my suggestion to use xfce.
I just told you it exists.
right, so I told you to run it from a terminal.
open a terminal, type "update-manager" and then enter
please stick to support in this channel
we have been working one on one.  I asked you to highlight me on your responses to me.

K. how come, when I turn my computer off. As in no power. when I turn it back on. It get stuck at a terminal looking screen.. And to get to my desktop. I have to hit ctrl - alt - F1. Then it goes to my desktop? It's never done that before
if you aren't sure your upgrade completed successfully, I would start there.  If that doesn't prove fruitful, than be more specific about where and how it gets stuck (what do you see)
How do I complete the upgrade just incase
initially, you would try to use update-manager
if you're replying to me, please use my nick as I am doing other things and will likely miss your response otherwise
